result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua W. Cunningham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Do not possess/consume alcohol or enter into any taverns.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances or be anywhere where they are consumed (only exception is those prescribed to the Defendant).

Obtain AODA assessment and follow recommendations of the assessor. 

Follow through with treatment and/or mental health counseling.  

Seek and maintain employment if Probation and Parole deems that condition appropriate.

Pay costs of supervision and court costs during term of probation.

Provide DNA sample to the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation. 

Credit in the event of revocation: 5 days.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Statement of Negotiated Plea

Defendant Joshua W. Cunningham in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. This hearing was originally set as jury status hearing. However, on this date, counsel have informed the Court that the def wishes to proceed to plea/sentencing. Court notes statement on negotiated plea with counsel's indication that def enter pleas for probation of 18 months with conditions. Def pleads guilty to both counts. Court's colloquy on pleas. Finding of guilty. Counsel and def address the Court. Sentence: on each count, withheld for 18 months probation. Conditions: not to possess/consume alcohol or enter into any taverns; not to possess/consume controlled substances or be anywhere where they are consumed (only exception is those prescribed to def); obtain AODA and follow recommendations; follow through with treatment and/or m.h. treatment/counseling; seek and maintain employment if probation and parole deems that condition appropriate; pay costs during term of probation; provide DNA sample to the RCSD before signing up for probation. Credit in the event of revocation: 5 days.
Per Crawford County JA, the hearing set for Jan. 15th has been moved to Feb. 12th at 9 due to a conflict on the Court's calendar; clerk to renotice the hearing
Jury status hearing at 02-12-2016 09:00 am
Jury status hearing at 01-15-2016 01:00 pm
correspondence with JA re. scheduling.
Defendants'...

Judge C's office is working to reschedule the 11/30 jury status hearing that was rescheduled at the request of the DA's office; defense counsel is not available 12/4 or 12/11, the next two dates Judge C is in Richland County

Jury status hearing at 11-30-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Joshua W. Cunningham in court with attorney Chelsey Nicole Ritter. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Def pleads NG.  Atty. Ritter states that SPD will be appointing a new attorney to this matter.  Counsel estimate 2 days for trial though ask that trial not be set at this time.  Counsel request status.  11/30 at 10 for jury status.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Bond corrected to state the amount - $1000 signature bond, not $0 as originally printed.  Conditions are the same as the original bond.

Def indicates, to clerk, that he has a different address but does not know it.  Clerk instructs def to obtain the address and place that current address on the bond.

Correction:  Amount of bond omitted from previous bond - $1000 signature.  Conditions are the same:  No in-person contact with KC or her residence (contact may occur by phone, email or other electronic means).  Court also orders no possession/consumption of alcohol and no entry into bars or taverns.  Defendant to submit to testing of blood, breath or urine as requested by law enforcement to monitor compliance.
Initial appearance at 11-06-2015 09:30 am

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: No in-person contact with KC or her residence (contact may occur by phone, email or other electronic means).  Court also orders no possession/consumption of alcohol and no entry into bars or taverns.  Defendant to submit to testing of blood, breath or urine as requested by law enforcement to monitor compliance.

Defendant Joshua W. Cunningham in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsey Nicole Ritter. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper filed this case today following conclusion of sentencing after revocation in 14CM165, a case presided over by Judge Michael Rosborough.  Judge Sharp has previously recused himself from matters involving this Defendant.  Court Commissioner Debra Schwarze is present and presides over this initial appearance, Judge Sharp having recused on this matter as well.  DA asks the Court to set bond.  DA requests 1k signature bond - no contact with KC (no in-person contact with her or her residence) plus no drink/no taverns with test on demand conditions as well.  Court orders 1k signature bond with conditions of no in-person contact with KC or her residence (contact may occur by phone, email or other electronic means).  Court also orders no possession/consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars, and def submit to blood, breath or urine tests at request of law enforcement.
